ei
Class EIAgent

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.Agent
      ei.EIAgent
All Implemented Interfaces:
jade.core.TimerListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ElectronicInstitutionGUIAgent, EnterpriseAgent, ExternalAgent, PlatformService
public abstract class EIAgent
extends jade.core.Agent

This is the base class for JADE agents in the Electronic Institution Platform.

Subclasses should override the setup() method to create agent behaviour(s), and invoke super.setup().

The EIAgent class includes a set of methods that are helpful for registering/deregistering the agent and its services with the DF.

The EIAgent implements the following interaction protocol roles:

  • ei-management responder role

Author:
hlc
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getConfigurationArguments

public java.util.Properties getConfigurationArguments()

setup

protected void setup()
This setup method:
  • iterates through the arguments provided to the agent to build the Properties object accordingly
  • registers the SL and Leap languages
  • registers the ei-management ontology
  • generates the public/private key pair for this agent
  • creates a responder behaviour for the EI_MANAGEMENT_ONTOLOGY
When extending this class, override this method to create agent behaviour(s) and invoke super.setup().

Overrides:
setup in class jade.core.Agent

takeDown

protected void takeDown()
When terminating, deregisters the agent from the DF if it is registered.

Overrides:
takeDown in class jade.core.Agent

registerServiceAtDF

protected void registerServiceAtDF(jade.domain.FIPAAgentManagement.ServiceDescription sd)
Registers a service for the agent at the DF. Note that previously registered services at the DF for this agent will be removed. In case this agent is not already registered at the DF, it will be registered with the provided service.

registerServicesAtDF

protected void registerServicesAtDF(java.util.Vector<jade.domain.FIPAAgentManagement.ServiceDescription> sds)
Registers services for the agent at the DF. Note that previously registered services at the DF for this agent will be removed. In case this agent is not already registered at the DF, it will be registered with the provided services.

fetchAgent

public jade.core.AID fetchAgent(java.lang.String service,
                                boolean forceDF)
Gets an agent providing the requested service. If one such agent is already acquainted, returns it. Otherwise, or if the forceDF flag is set, searches the DF. Note that service here is a DF term, not necessarily an institutional service.

Parameters:
service - The service to search for
forceDF - A flag indicating if a DF search should be always executed or only if necessary
Returns:
The AID of an agent providing the requested service

fetchAgent

public jade.core.AID fetchAgent(java.lang.String service)
Gets an agent providing the requested service. If more than one is available, returns the first one. Note that service here is a DF term, not necessarily an institutional service.

Parameters:
service - The service to be discovered
Returns:
The AID for the agent providing the service

fetchAgents

public jade.domain.FIPAAgentManagement.DFAgentDescription[] fetchAgents(java.lang.String service)
Searches the DF for agents providing the requested service, as registered at the DF. Note that service here is a DF term, not necessarily an institutional service.

Parameters:
service - The service to be discovered
Returns:
An array with all the DFAgentDescriptions obtained from the DF

providesService

public boolean providesService(jade.core.AID agent,
                               java.lang.String srv)
Checks if a specific agent provides a specific service.

Parameters:
ag - The requester, needed for DFService
agent - The agent to check the service for
srv - The service
Returns:
true if the agent provides the service; false otherwise
